citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
On March 10, 2025, tissue collection procedures were not followed as outline in the protocol under SOP - Tissue
Collection. The veterinarian noticed one ferret was still breathing and the skin was removed from its abdomen and thorax.
The veterinarian asked the technicians to verify if euthanasia had been performed. Euthanasia had not been performed
per SOP. The ferret was immediately euthanized and tissue collection continued as outlined in the facility SOP. The ferret
did not experience any pain or distress as all procedures were performed under anesthesia. Team members failed to
follow established procedures in the SOP.
Procedures in an IACUC approved protocol must be followed to ensure animals do not experience unnecessary pain or
distress. Proposed activities for animal use that are approved by the IACUC should be followed or further appropriate
review and approval would be needed in accordance with 2.31(d) of Subpart C.
Correction: All team members were retrained on the SOP for Tissue Collection and Euthanasia and the importance of
following the SOP. An emphasis was placed on communicating responsibilities prior to starting the procedures as well as
during the process.
,
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.31(d)(8) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
On March 10, 2025, tissue collection procedures were not followed as outline in the protocol under SOP - Tissue 
Collection. The veterinarian noticed one ferret was still breathing and the skin was removed from its abdomen and thorax. 
The veterinarian asked the technicians to verify if euthanasia had been performed. Euthanasia had not been performed 
per SOP. The ferret was immediately euthanized and tissue collection continued as outlined in the facility SOP. The ferret 
did not experience any pain or distress as all procedures were performed under anesthesia. Team members failed to 
follow established procedures in the SOP.  
 
Procedures in an IACUC approved protocol must be followed to ensure animals do not experience unnecessary pain or 
distress. Proposed activities for animal use that are approved by the IACUC should be followed or further appropriate 
review and approval would be needed in accordance with 2.31(d) of Subpart C. 
 
Correction: All team members were retrained on the SOP for Tissue Collection and Euthanasia and the importance of 
following the SOP. An emphasis was placed on communicating responsibilities prior to starting the procedures as well as 
during the process.  
, 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n
